pain_points_original.title: Modernizing Public Service Delivery with AI
pain_points_original.description: The government seeks to fundamentally transform its operations by using AI to enhance efficiency, inform decision-making, and innovate service delivery to achieve better community outcomes and public satisfaction.

pain_points_original.title: Ensuring Data Security & Compliance in AI
pain_points_original.description: A critical challenge is adopting AI while ensuring the absolute security and safeguarding of sensitive government data, demanding strict compliance with all ICT, security, cyber, and privacy policies (IPPs).

pain_points_original.title: Integrating AI with Legacy Government Systems
pain_points_original.description: A key strategic hurdle is the ability to assess and integrate new, scalable, and adaptable AI solutions with existing government IT systems, which is critical for successful and non-disruptive implementation.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of AI Market & Costing Intelligence
pain_points_original.description: The government is in an early information-gathering phase, needing to understand the landscape of AI tools, solutions, and pricing models to inform future procurement strategies, policy, and budget allocation.
